title: Oracle WebCenter Sites Support Tools available and Information disclosure (/cs/Satellite)

profile.name: LocalTapiola
profile.about: LocalTapiolaâ€™s products and services cover non-life, life and pension insurance, as well as investment and saving services.

vulnerability_information:
Oracle WebCenter Sites Support Tools are available in: www.lahitapiola.fi

This software is password protected, but some pages are publicly available and reveal internal information.

The welcome page is located at: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo?pagename=Support/Home

This page reveal data as the running user: DefaultReader and the internal server name: s17334.tapiola.fi

Also other information like the server context:
* cs_version:'Oracle WebCenter Sites 11.1.1.6.1  Build Date: Nov 13 2013 at 19:25:33 Build Number: 66 Revision:160478'
* java_runtime_version:'1.6.0_38-b05'
* java_version:'1.6.0_38'
* java_vm_version:'20.13-b02'
* os_arch:'amd64'
* os_name:'Linux'
* os_version:'2.6.18-308.16.1.el5'
* os_proc: 4
* ws_info:'Apache Tomcat/7.0.35'

There are other available pages like:
http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo?pagename=Support/Performance/Home
http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo?pagename=Support/Performance/Standard/Home

These pages are also accessible through: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/cs/Satellite

For example: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/cs/Satellite?pagename=Support/Home

I have tested default Fatwire usernames and passwords, and it seems that they were changed, but anyway it is recommended to check the credentials of the users allowed to login from Internet.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. LocalTapiola takes security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this report until we have determined whether this is a bug and what any potential impact (or fix) will be.

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 7 days, but usually much faster. Bounty decisions are made 1-2 times per month, so please have patience.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. LocalTapiola takes security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this report until we have determined whether this is a bug and what any potential impact (or fix) will be.

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 7 days, but usually much faster. Bounty decisions are made 1-2 times per month, so please have patience.

additional_data.old_title: Oracle WebCenter Sites Support Tools available and Information disclosure
additional_data.new_title: Oracle WebCenter Sites Support Tools available and Information disclosure (/cs/Satellite)

activities.message: We have looked at this and decided to try to fix it although the business impact is not very significant. The date for the fix is not known at the moment.
activities.markdown_message: We have looked at this and decided to try to fix it although the business impact is not very significant. The date for the fix is not known at the moment.

activities.message: Heads up: We are testing some (potential) fixes for this during the coming days. This does not mean that there is a final fix yet. So please be patience, once we are done, we will let you know.
activities.markdown_message: Heads up: We are testing some (potential) fixes for this during the coming days. This does not mean that there is a final fix yet. So please be patience, once we are done, we will let you know.

activities.message: Leo here from LocalTapiola. Some updates on this one. The fix is now in production. Please could you retest this and inform back to us?
activities.markdown_message: Leo here from LocalTapiola. Some updates on this one. The fix is now in production. Please could you retest this and inform back to us?

activities.message: It seems that all Support Tools pages are gone and not reachable through the Fatwire servlet. So it's fixed.
activities.markdown_message: It seems that all Support Tools pages are gone and not reachable through the Fatwire servlet. So it's fixed.

activities.message:
By the way. I have checked other unused Fatwire pages and they are also gone. For example the one vulnerable to reflected XSS that I reported in #164578 (https://www.lahitapiola.fi/cs/Satellite?pagename=OpenMarket/Xcelerate/UIFramework/LoginError).

Also the demo pages are not reachable: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo?pagename=OpenMarket/Demos/index

Congratulations. It seems that the Fatwire pages clean was general. This is great because it reduces the attack surface.
activities.markdown_message:
By the way. I have checked other unused Fatwire pages and they are also gone. For example the one vulnerable to reflected XSS that I reported in #164578 (https://www.lahitapiola.fi/cs/Satellite?pagename=OpenMarket/Xcelerate/UIFramework/LoginError).

Also the demo pages are not reachable: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo?pagename=OpenMarket/Demos/index

Congratulations. It seems that the Fatwire pages clean was general. This is great because it reduces the attack surface.

summaries.content:
##Issue

The reporter found an issue in the Oracle Webcenter Sites Support Tools (Fatwire) which lead to a minor technical information leakage. 

##Fix

The issue was investigated and found to be valid. The fix was to remove the leaking functionality.

##Reasoning

The reported case was valid and within the scope of the bug bounty program. The issue was fixed and the reporter was awarded with a bounty. The bounty was based on consequence-risk assessment.
summaries.content_html:
Issue

The reporter found an issue in the Oracle Webcenter Sites Support Tools (Fatwire) which lead to a minor technical information leakage.

Fix

The issue was investigated and found to be valid. The fix was to remove the leaking functionality.

Reasoning

The reported case was valid and within the scope of the bug bounty program. The issue was fixed and the reporter was awarded with a bounty. The bounty was based on consequence-risk assessment.
